hints.content: Start by understanding the problem clearly. You need to find a substring where each character appears at most twice. What does a substring mean in this context?
Consider using a sliding window approach. This involves maintaining a window of characters and adjusting its size based on the conditions of the problem.
Think about how you can keep track of the counts of each character within your current window. A dictionary or an array can be useful for this purpose.
As you expand your window to the right, check if adding a new character violates the condition of having at most two occurrences. If it does, you'll need to shrink the window from the left.
When shrinking the window, make sure to update your character counts accordingly. This is crucial to maintain the correct state of your window.
Consider edge cases, such as when the string consists of the same character repeated multiple times. How does your approach handle such cases?
Think about how to keep track of the maximum length of valid substrings you encounter as you iterate through the string.
Remember that the constraints specify a minimum length of 2 for the string. This means you won't have to handle empty strings or single-character strings.
Make sure to return the length of the longest valid substring, not the substring itself. This is an important distinction.
As a final step, ensure your solution runs efficiently within the provided constraints. Aim for a linear time complexity if possible.

questionNotes: s consists only of lowercase English letters.
Return the length of the longest valid substring, not the substring itself.
Each character in the substring can appear at most two times.
